worklogs.comment:
pudidic opened a new pull request #2079: ARROW-2632: [Java] ArrowStreamWriter accumulates ArrowBlock but does not use them
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2079
 
 
   ArrowStreamWriter inherits from ArrowWriter the behavior of accumulating an ArrowBlock for each ArrowRecordBatch that is written. But this data is never used in the context of ArrowStreamWriter. writeRecordBatch can be overridden in ArrowStreamWriter to avoid adding the memory overhead.

----------------------------------------------------------------

siddharthteotia commented on a change in pull request #2079: ARROW-2632: [Java] ArrowStreamWriter accumulates ArrowBlock but does not use them
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2079#discussion_r190663558
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/ipc/ArrowStreamWriter.java
 ##########
 @@ -52,4 +54,9 @@ protected void endInternal(WriteChannel out,
                              List<ArrowBlock> records) throws IOException {
     out.writeIntLittleEndian(0);
   }
+
+  @Override
+  protected void writeRecordBatch(ArrowRecordBatch batch) throws IOException {
 
 Review comment:
   I am not sure how this method helps in saving memory overhead as mentioned in PR description. Can you please elaborate on the usage of this method?

EricWohlstadter commented on a change in pull request #2079: ARROW-2632: [Java] ArrowStreamWriter accumulates ArrowBlock but does not use them
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2079#discussion_r190713628
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/ipc/ArrowStreamWriter.java
 ##########
 @@ -52,4 +54,9 @@ protected void endInternal(WriteChannel out,
                              List<ArrowBlock> records) throws IOException {
     out.writeIntLittleEndian(0);
   }
+
+  @Override
+  protected void writeRecordBatch(ArrowRecordBatch batch) throws IOException {
 
 Review comment:
   Hi @siddharthteotia 
   
   If you trace the data flow for ArrowStreamWriter, the line inherited by ArrowWriter.writeRecordBatch:
   
   ```
   recordBlocks.add(block);
   ```
   
   accumulates ArrowBlock in a list that is never used by ArrowStreamWriter. 
   
   The recordBlocks list is used by a different sub-class of ArrowWriter at ArrowFileWriter.endInternal.
   
   This was confirmed by @elahrvivaz on the dev list.
   

----------------------------------------------------------------
